What is the purpose of the `rescanfromheight` command in Verus?
The `rescanfromheight` command is used to rescan the current wallet from a specified height. This command can be used to recover missing transactions or to re-sync the wallet with the blockchain.

rescanfromheight (height) Rescans the current wallet from a specified height Arguments: 1. "height"   (int, optional) Defaults to 0, height to start rescanning from Note: This call can take minutes or even hours to complete on very large wallets and rescans Examples: Initiate rescan of entire chain > verus rescanfromheight Initiate rescan from block 1000000 > verus rescanfromheight 1000000
./raw_text_input_api_text/rescanfromheight
What is the default height from which the `rescanfromheight` command starts rescanning if no height is specified?
If no height is specified, the `rescanfromheight` command defaults to 0, which means it will start rescanning from the beginning of the blockchain.

rescanfromheight (height) Rescans the current wallet from a specified height Arguments: 1. "height"   (int, optional) Defaults to 0, height to start rescanning from Note: This call can take minutes or even hours to complete on very large wallets and rescans Examples: Initiate rescan of entire chain > verus rescanfromheight Initiate rescan from block 1000000 > verus rescanfromheight 1000000

How long does the `rescanfromheight` command take to complete, and what factors affect its completion time?

The `rescanfromheight` command can take minutes or even hours to complete, depending on the size of the wallet and the height from which it is rescanning. Larger wallets and higher heights will result in longer completion times.

rescanfromheight (height) Rescans the current wallet from a specified height Arguments: 1. "height"   (int, optional) Defaults to 0, height to start rescanning from Note: This call can take minutes or even hours to complete on very large wallets and rescans Examples: Initiate rescan of entire chain > verus rescanfromheight Initiate rescan from block 1000000 > verus rescanfromheight 1000000

How do I initiate a rescan of the entire chain using the `rescanfromheight` command?
To initiate a rescan of the entire chain, simply run the command `verus rescanfromheight` without specifying a height. This will start the rescan from the beginning of the blockchain.

rescanfromheight (height) Rescans the current wallet from a specified height Arguments: 1. "height"   (int, optional) Defaults to 0, height to start rescanning from Note: This call can take minutes or even hours to complete on very large wallets and rescans Examples: Initiate rescan of entire chain > verus rescanfromheight Initiate rescan from block 1000000 > verus rescanfromheight 1000000
./raw_text_input_api_text/rescanfromheight
How do I initiate a rescan from a specific block height using the `rescanfromheight` command?

To initiate a rescan from a specific block height, run the command `verus rescanfromheight <height>`, replacing `<height>` with the desired block height. For example, to rescan from block 1000000, run `verus rescanfromheight 1000000`.

rescanfromheight (height) Rescans the current wallet from a specified height Arguments: 1. "height"   (int, optional) Defaults to 0, height to start rescanning from Note: This call can take minutes or even hours to complete on very large wallets and rescans Examples: Initiate rescan of entire chain > verus rescanfromheight Initiate rescan from block 1000000 > verus rescanfromheight 1000000
